intro: Sabatia australis, commonly known as the southern sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in open areas such as dunes, coastal bluffs, and pine flatwoods. It has hairy, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Sabatia australis is an important plant for pollinators and is often found in coastal and inland habitats across its range.
